DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study was to determine the efficacy and safety of calcium carbonate for the prevention of nelfinavir-associated diarrhea and to evaluate the efficacy and safety of calcium carbonate in combination with loperamide for the treatment of nelfinavir-associated diarrhea.
DOC.brief_title: A Study to Determine Effective Prophylaxis and Treatment of Nelfinavir-Associated Diarrhea
DOC.criteria: Antiretroviralnaive patients with HIV1 infection not more than 2 loose stools per day or any preexisting or emerging medical condition that would interfere with the evaluation of therapeutic response of the study drug No antidiarrheal medication within 7 days prior to entry Greater than or equal to 2 loose stools per day lasting 2 or more days within 7 days prior to study entry Bloody stools within 7 days prior to study entry Any unstable or severe intercurrent medical condition, including active opportunistic infections
